title: Sam Allardyce reveals why Mauricio Pochettino will reject Manchester United move
text:
Pochettino’s future is unclear (Picture: AFP via Getty Images)

Mauricio Pochettino will not ditch Tottenham Hotspur for Manchester United because Spurs have a stronger squad, according to former England manager Sam Allardyce.

After a testing start to the season, which has left the north London side languishing in ninth in the Premier League table and 13 points off leaders Liverpool, Pochettino’s future has come under the spotlight once more.

Things have been going even worse for Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s Manchester United.

Just two points above the relegation zone after eight games played, the Norwegian manager is under huge pressure.

Pochettino has long been linked with a move to Manchester and was thought to be primed to replace Jose Mourinho before Solskjaer’s impressive spell as caretaker manager earned him the job.

But while rumours continue to suggest he could replace the under fire Solskjaer, former West Ham and Newcastle manager Allardyce sees no reason why he would swap the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium for Old Trafford.

‘I can’t see Mauricio going anywhere at the moment,’ Allardyce said.

‘At the moment, Tottenham are a better squad than Manchester United – and that is a telling fact.

‘It’s alright saying, “this is Manchester United, one of the biggest clubs in the world”, but has it got the team to go with it to represent Manchester United?’
